title: Biohazard Sign

adjectives: Used of the language of the deaf
verbs: Mark with one's signature; write one's name (on)
To write (one's name) at the bottom of a document; to sign (one's name).
nouns: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

A biological agent -- also called bio-agent, biological threat agent, biological warfare agent, biological weapon, or bioweapon -- is a bacterium, virus, protozoan, parasite, or fungus that can be used purposefully as a weapon in bioterrorism or biological warfare.
Infectious disease or toxin that can be used in bioterrorism or biological warfare
Biological hazards, also known as biohazards, refer to biological substances that pose a threat to the health of living organisms, primarily that of humans.
Any bacterium or virus or toxin that could be used in biological warfare
An instance or cause of liable harm.
Instance or cause of liable harm.
The condition of being susceptible to harm or injury

description:
A hazard symbol used in the labeling of biological materials that carry a significant health risk, including viral and bacteriological samples.

Generally displayed on an orange or yellow background.
apple_vendor_description: The biohazard symbol on Apple devices is rendered with a striking, cautionary yellow and black color scheme, adhering to its universally recognized warning. Apple's design language imbues it with a polished, almost three-dimensional appearance, thanks to its glossy shading and clear, defined lines that emphasize its critical nature. This emoji is used to signify danger, biological risks, or hazardous materials, conveying a sense of urgency and awareness in digital contexts.
